moves.1. Nf3: My last game with the Reti Opening was weird, so I'll try it again.
moves.1... d5 2. d4: Transposing into a queen's pawn game.
moves.2... c6 3. c4 dxc4: An unusual time to accept the gambit, although the Slav Accepted does so on the fourth turn.
moves.4. e3: Threatening to win the pawn back; it seems to be the most common move here.
moves.4... Qa5+: Probably an overly aggressive queen move; there is no real threat.
moves.6... Qh5 7. Bxc4: The queen hasn't done anything other than allow me to develop with tempo, and now I can retake the pawn with a significant developmental lead.  The bishop also eyes f7, although e6 easily breaks this up.
moves.7... Nh6: The f pawn doesn't need another defender, so why not Nf6?
moves.8. O-O: I'm unsure about castling kingside, but this seems the best way to continue development.
moves.8... Bg4: Perhaps the castling was too early; black threatens to open the g file.
moves.9. Rc1: I don't want to retreat my bishop to e2, and after 9...Bxf3 10. Qxf3 Qxf3 11. gxf3, it looks fine, since I still have a large lead in development and my rook can use the g file.  Therefore I develop my other rook.
moves.9... Nd7 10. Qb3: Unpins the knight, attacks b7, and adds pressure to f7.
moves.11. h3: I want to push d5, but I want a rook at d1 first.  I don't want the knight to be pinned, so I drive away the bishop first. Better would have been Nb5, with similar threats as later in the game; if 11...cxb5?, 12. Bxf7  wins the queen.  However, this turns out to lose a pawn.
moves.11... Bxf3 12. gxf3 Qxh3 13. Bxf7: If 13...Nxf7 14. Qxf7, it's still not optimal, but not too bad. If 13...Qxf3 14. Nb5 looks like a potential mating combination or significant material loss for black with 15. Nxa7 .
moves.13... Qxf3 14. Nb5: Sacrificing the bishop and threatening Nxa7 .
moves.14... Nxf7: Black could have declined the sacrifice with Kb8.
moves.15. Nxa7+ Kc7: 15...Kb8 16. Nxc6  Kc8 (16...Ka8? 17. Qa4#) 17. Nd5  wins the queen.
moves.16. Ba5+ Kd6: b6 was the saving move; after 17. Nxc6, white can eventually also win the rook for the knight, evening up material.
moves.17. Nb5+: I finally see a mate in two: 17...cxb5 (forced) 18. Bc7#.
